column4: folks; my max resolutoin on my second monitor is 1280x1024; but with nvidia-settings; it shows my max resolution to be 640x480.... is there anyway of fixing this?  (ubuntu + feisty + nvidia graphics card 7950 gt otc)
perhaps you should do sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, after you backup /etc/X11/xorg.conf
really/
yeah
what is your monitor? perhaps your refresh values in xorg.conf need to be adjusted
its a cheap one from frys.... not a brand name  ; it was wokring before i installed newer nvidia drivers (FROM .11 to .19)
yeah, you probably just need to adjust your horiz/vert refresh values in xorg.conf
so i should try typing in the IP address i see in eth0?
are you bridging or NATing the VM internet connection?
i'm not sure to be honest
you could just try the private IP address of the Ubuntu machine
where do i find that IP address?
ifconfig on the Ubuntu host?
usser i'm using NAT for internet (and it works in terms of letting me access internet via VM)
i'm not sure which device i should be looking for ?  eth0
thats it, though
perhaps you'll have to specify the IP address of the gateway of the VM machine
how should id o that?
no, because you said the VM was using NAT
ipconfig /all in XP?
k go ahea and try it
wont hurt anything
try booting with all_generic_ide kernel option
else just install with alternate CD
